description: {"blocks":[{"key":"emg51","text":"Most of the defining mutations of the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) variants of concern (VOCs) have been identified in the S gene sequence. For this reason, S-based lineage assignment is possible using the current nomenclature system. We have developed a protocol for overlapping amplification of the S gene sequence using previously reported primer sequences (V3 primers of ARTIC Network) in combination with a PCR barcoding approach of the samples for Nanopore sequencing platforms. This protocol allows a fast and cost-effective screening of COVID-19 positive samples for lineage/clade assignment and mutational surveillance of the spike gene.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ff7n8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
